definition: composed of more than one part, an enclosure of residences and other building (especially in the Orient), to put or add together
details:
adjective
- composed of more than one part
= example: composed of more than one part
- composed of many distinct individuals united to form a whole or colony
= synonyms: colonial
- consisting of two or more substances or ingredients or elements or parts
= example: consisting of two or more substances or ingredients or elements or parts
noun
- an enclosure of residences and other building (especially in the Orient)
- a whole formed by a union of two or more elements or parts
- (chemistry) a substance formed by chemical union of two or more elements or ingredients in definite proportion by weight
= synonyms: chemical compound
verb
- to put or add together
= synonyms: combine
- to make more intense, stronger, or more marked
= synonyms: intensify, deepen, heighten
- to combine so as to form a whole
= synonyms: combine
- to create by mixing or combining
= example: to create by mixing or combining
- to calculate principal and interest
